page.title: 07Farming
page.content: It is a mixed farming area with emphasis on cattle rearing, dairy farming and crops such as barley, wheat and a few acres in potatoes. There are a few large dairy farms. Glen Mills Dairy on the Banbridge Road put the milk in cartons and sell it around to householders, local shops and large chain stores. Most of the farms are very large, some exceeding 100 acres. A lot of silage is cut during late May and early June. Little hay is now made in the summer. Milk is collected by tankers from the various farms and brought to Creamline Dairy, Lurgan. Cattle are mostly sold at livestock markets in Markethill and Lurgan.
